timeline.bodyText: is doReturn better than the other way?
timeline.author: macfarla

replies.bodyText:
We prefer when(context.queryParamMap()).thenReturn(...) if at all possible because it's actually type safe. This includes if you have to declare the mock as a generic type and use SuppressWarnings because mock(Supplier.class) is untyped. Otherwise if the return type changes, the compiler won't flag it.
But sometimes it's unavoidable  (e.g. if something returns a SafeFuture<?> you can't ever have something that satisfies that because it can't know what ? is to see if you satisfied it, and I think there are a few other corner cases as well.
